Class ExtractData

ExtractData
Direct Known Subclasses:

    Method
    Description
    protected FileData
    extractFromFile()
    This is used to extract data from Multiple Files- works with CPL and OPL, assumes all checks done within functions called work This is an overloaded function

    extractFromFile(boolean flag)
    This is used to extract data from Multiple Files- works with MPO and MV, assumes all checks done within functions called work this is an overloaded function
    protected abstract void
    formatBallotInformation(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> partyCandidates, int numSeats)
    This is an abstract method that will be initialized in ExtractDataOPL, ExtractDataCPL, and ExtractDataMPO.
    protected HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>>
    formatPartyInformation(int numParties, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes)
    This method will read as many lines as there are number of parties in the file, the first word in the line will be used as the key in the HashMap and the rest beyond the first , will be added to the Arraylist of string, which represents the list of candidates for a party This is an overloaded function: CPL and OPL files
    protected HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>>
    formatPartyInformation(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, boolean flag)
    This method will read one line in the file, it will seperate that one line into a formatted string array, where the first of two indecies is the name of the candidate and the second of the two indicies is the party of the candidate This is an overloaded function: MPO and MV files
    protected void
    putVotesInPartyVotes(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> partyCandidates, String candidateName, ArrayList<Integer> tempCount, int index)
    This will get the party associated with the candidate name It then gets the votes associated with the candidate name Using this information it places the votes in the location of the party in partyVotes
    protected boolean
    verifyLineIsDigit(String line)
    This will look through the given string, if it finds a character that is not a digit a message will be given to the user and the program will close with a system.exit()

  • Method Details

    • extractFromFile

      protected FileData extractFromFile() throws IOException
      This is used to extract data from Multiple Files- works with CPL and OPL, assumes all checks done within functions called work This is an overloaded function
      Returns:
      fileData, this is a FileData object containing the information from the extracted file
      Throws:
      IOException

    • extractFromFile

      protected FileData extractFromFile(boolean flag) throws IOException
      This is used to extract data from Multiple Files- works with MPO and MV, assumes all checks done within functions called work this is an overloaded function
      Parameters:
      flag - represents the boolean flag indicator that you should use the extractFromFile for the MPO or MV files
      Returns:
      fileData, this is a FileData object containing the information from the extracted file
      Throws:
      IOException

    • verifyLineIsDigit

      protected boolean verifyLineIsDigit(String line)
      This will look through the given string, if it finds a character that is not a digit a message will be given to the user and the program will close with a system.exit()
      Parameters:
      line - represents a string of the line from the file. This line should only be digits

    • formatPartyInformation

      protected HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> formatPartyInformation(int numParties, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes) throws IOException
      This method will read as many lines as there are number of parties in the file, the first word in the line will be used as the key in the HashMap and the rest beyond the first , will be added to the Arraylist of string, which represents the list of candidates for a party This is an overloaded function: CPL and OPL files
      Parameters:
      numParties - this represents the number of parties that are listed in the given file
      partyVotes - this is an ArrayList which contains inner mappings of a party name and the number of corresponding votes
      candidateVotes - this is an ArrayList which contains inner mappings of a candidate name and the number of corresponding votes
      Returns:
      HashMap that represents a key value of a party name to a list of candidate names
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error while reading the validFile

    • formatPartyInformation

      protected HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> formatPartyInformation(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, boolean flag) throws IOException
      This method will read one line in the file, it will seperate that one line into a formatted string array, where the first of two indecies is the name of the candidate and the second of the two indicies is the party of the candidate This is an overloaded function: MPO and MV files
      Parameters:
      partyVotes - this is an ArrayList which contains inner mappings of a party name and the number of corresponding votes
      candidateVotes - this is an ArrayList which contains inner mappings of a candidate name and the number of corresponding votes
      flag - this is a boolean flag retrieved from extractFromFile to indicate that you are formatting party information from an MPO or an MV file
      Returns:
      HashMap that represents a key value of a party name to a list of candidate names
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error while reading the validFile

    • putVotesInPartyVotes

      protected void putVotesInPartyVotes(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> partyCandidates, String candidateName, ArrayList<Integer> tempCount, int index)
      This will get the party associated with the candidate name It then gets the votes associated with the candidate name Using this information it places the votes in the location of the party in partyVotes
      Parameters:
      partyVotes - this is an ArrayList which contains inner mappings of a party name and the number of corresponding votes
      candidateVotes - this is an ArrayList whih contains inner mappings of a candidate name and the number of corresponding votes
      partyCandidates - this is a mapping of a party name to an ordered list of their candidates
      candidateName - this is the name of the current candidate whose votes are being added to partyVotes
      tempCount - this is an ArrayList which contains the number of votes in the current file that was read
      index - this is the index of the current candidate's votes in tempCount

    • formatBallotInformation

      protected abstract void formatBallotInformation(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> partyVotes, ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> candidateVotes, HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> partyCandidates, int numSeats) throws IOException
      This is an abstract method that will be initialized in ExtractDataOPL, ExtractDataCPL, and ExtractDataMPO. When initialized, this method will format the ballots to update the number of votes in partyVotes and in OPL will also update the number of votes in candidateVotes
      Parameters:
      partyVotes - is a mapping of multiple party names to their corresponding number of votes
      candidateVotes - is a mapping of multiple candidate names to their corresponing number of votes
      partyCandidates -
      Throws:
      IOException
